article_text:
A True Relation of Such Occurrences and Accidents of Noate as Hath Hapned in Virginia Since the First Planting of That Collony

By John Smith (1608)

1Capt. John Smith was not only a brave soldier but also a considerable writer. This, his first publication, uses the language of the old dependable world to encompass a strange new one. His narrative begins in April 1607, when he and other adventurers landed at Jamestown, where they met Indians who offered fish, bread and strawberries. The Indians received, in turn, “Bels,...
